toss.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to throw something, especially something light, with a quick gentle movement of your hand
toss.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: She crumpled the letter and tossed it into the fire.
Toss that book over, will you?
‘Catch!’ said Sandra, tossing her bag to him.
toss.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to move about continuously in a violent or uncontrolled way, or to make something do this
toss.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The small boat was tossed about like a cork.
toss.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to throw a coin in the air, so that a decision will be made according to the side that faces upwards when it comes down
toss.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: They tossed a coin to decide who would go first.
We couldn’t make up our minds, so we decided to toss for it.
toss.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to throw something up into the air and let it fall to the ground
toss.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: The crowd cheered, banging pots and tossing confetti into the air.
toss.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: to move pieces of food about in a small amount of liquid so that they become covered with the liquid
toss.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: Toss the carrots in some butter before serving.
toss.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: the act of throwing a coin in the air to decide something, especially who will do something first in a game
toss.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The toss of a coin decided who would go first.
Malory won the toss and will serve.
toss.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a sudden backwards movement of your head, so that your hair moves, often showing anger
toss.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: ‘I’ll see, ’ the nurse said, with an officious toss of her head.
